thread.title: Cafe St. Jorge gets new owners on Mission Street
thread.title_full: Cafe St. Jorge gets new owners on Mission Street

author: Justin Phillips
title: Cafe St. Jorge gets new owners on Mission Street

locations.name: cafe st. jorge  andrea de francisco

text:
Cafe St. Jorge gets new owners on Mission Street By Justin Phillips on January 12, 2017 at 3:25 PM cafestjorge1-copy Photo via Cafe St. Jorge 
Andrea de Francisco , founder of Cafe St. Jorge on Mission Street, is handing her Portuguese-inspired cafe over to new owners. 
The cafe went up for sale about a year and a half ago, de Francisco told Inside Scoop. The license transfer is expected to be completed by the end of February. 
The ownership change isn’t going to influence the cafe’s concept. She said the new owners — the Saleh family, first-time restaurateurs — are keeping the staff, menu, and decor exactly as it is now. 
While de Francisco’s name won’t be on the cafe’s documents, it will ll still be on the menu: Andrea’s Portuguese breakfast board comes with a baguette, ham, cheese and butter. 
“I was looking for the right owners that would keep it the same, that was really important,” she said. 
When Cafe St. Jorge opened in 2013, de Francisco said it was her way of expressing passion for her own Portuguese heritage. The place is named after the place in the Azores from where her family stems. It became a staple over the years at its spot at the base of Bernal Heights, along Mission Street. 
Cafe St. Jorge: 3438 Mission Street, at Kingston. cafestjorge.com Search Keyword search across all the entries in this blog. Browse previous blog posts by month and year of entry.
